thread.title: Danny Dyer 'didn't have a meltdown at the NTAs and didn't even go to the after party'
thread.title_full: Danny Dyer 'didn't have a meltdown at the NTAs and didn't even go to the after party'

author: Vicki Newman
title: Danny Dyer 'didn't have a meltdown at the NTAs and didn't even go to the after party'
text:
Danny Dyer 'didn't have a meltdown at the NTAs and didn't even go to the after party' A source close to the show said it was "nonsense" Share Danny Dyer 'didn't have a meltdown at the National Television Awards' (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Danny Dyer was reportedly calmed down by his co-stars at the National Television Awards after suffering a meltdown. 
But a source close to EastEnders have quashed the rumours and branded them "nonsense". 
The actor is currently taking time off from his role as Queen Vic landlord Mick Carter in the BBC soap. 
A video posted on The Sun Online claimed to show the moment EastEnders bosses knew Danny needed to 'sort out his wild lifestyle'. 
In the video, in the aftermath of the NTAs ceremony, Danny is stood talking to his co-stars and people involved in the show. Read More Danny Dyer's concerned mum 'begged Alan Carr not to let him get drunk' on chat show Danny had presented an award at the NTAs (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
At one point, a man places his hand on Danny's shoulder and the actor goes in for a hug, apparently saying goodbye to his pal. 
Danny continues to do the rounds chatting and sharing tales with his co-workers. 
The footage appears to show the star being comforted by friends including Laurie Brett and James Bye, with the latter wrapping an arm around his pal. 
It was claimed that the 39-year-old actor was raging after the awards bash and had to be calmed down, but a source tells us that wasn't the case. He plays Mick Carter in the soap (Photo: BBC) 
A source close to the programme told Mirror Celeb: "It's absolute nonsense, just looking at the video you can tell he's not having a meltdown or having a go at his co-stars. 
"The situation is that everyone was trying to leave the arena but couldn't at that moment so everyone was just stood around talking. 
"Danny didn't even go to the after party and he wasn't drunk. He had a couple of beers but wasn't in a state and didn't have to be calmed down. It's just nonsense." 
Mirror Celeb has contacted Danny's representatives for comment. Like us on Facebook
